alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 13 at 11:21AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River at Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Water levels are running high and going overbank in some low lying areas along the Tanana River near Manley Hot Springs. Fluctuating water levels have caused flooding of the parking lot at Manley Landing on the Tanana River. Ice jam flooding is possible and has a high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water or significant flooding. Large chunks of ice could push overbank along the Tanana River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A local pilot reported that an ice jam 6 miles downriver from Manley Hot Springs was starting to deteriorate on Friday afternoon. It is possible another ice jam could develop 12 miles downriver from Manley Hot Springs where ice was still in place. In addition, the river gauge on Manley Hot Spring Slough is showing water levels continuing to rise and are within a foot of reaching flood stage as of Saturday morning. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River at Manley Hot Springs stay alert and be prepared to take action. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare for possible flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
